inspiracio.net
Class UTF8URLEncoder

java.lang.Object
  inspiracio.net.UTF8URLEncoder

public class UTF8URLEncoder
extends Object

Like java.net.URLEncoder, but always uses UTF-8 and does not throw EncodingUnsupportedException.

Encodes according to application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME format. UTF-8 is always supported and should always be used.

encodeSemantic

public static String encodeSemantic(String s)
Returns a String that is similar to the input-String but is ok to put in semantic URLs. The method works for languages that are mainly Latin + diacritics, It does not work for other languages.

The result is obtained like this:

  1. change all chars to lowercase (because many users don't distinguish uppercase and lowercase)
  2. remove diacritical marks from these characters: "áàäçéèëíìïóòöúùüñ"
  3. substitute all chars by '-' except; a-z, 0-9, dot, hyphen, underscore.
  4. substitute multiple hyphens by single hyphen
  5. remove initial hyphen and final hyphen
  6. if nothing survives, return "-".
See URL spec in http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt. See trac http://bcnserver/trac/area-tecnica/ticket/3819. See class java.net.IDN for an alternative approach.

Parameters:
s -
Returns:
URL-encoded form

isSafe

public static boolean isSafe(char c)
True if this character is safe in URL-encoding. According to application/x-www-form-urlencoded MIME format. Permits:
  • a-z
  • A-Z
  • 0-9
  • .-_ dot hyphen underscore
Does not accept * asterisk, although it is okay for a URL (see http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2396.txt), where it is classified as mark. But the trac http://bcnserver/trac/area-tecnica/ticket/3819 prefers to exclude it to adapt to habits of the online survey industry.

Parameters:
c -
Returns:
boolean
